body_content.explanation: the horizontal pole of a tent, positioned at the top where the two sloping sides meet:
examples: The ridge pole was broken so the roof of the tent sagged.

body_content.explanation: a horizontal piece of wood along the ridge of a roof (= the part where the sloping sides meet the top):
examples: The huts are seldom more than five or six feet high from the ridge pole to the ground.
Pairs of timbers are raised to form a roof shape, linked by a ridgepole to support the roof.
